name: Apply
description: The apply operation applies a definition in a specific context
comment: The result of invoking this operation is a resource of the type specified by the activity definition, with all the definitions resolved as appropriate for the type of resource. Any dynamicValue elements will be evaluated (in the order in which they appear in the resource) and the results applied to the returned resource.  If the ActivityDefinition includes library references, those libraries will be available to the evaluated expressions. If those libraries have parameters, those parameters will be bound by name to the parameters given to the operation. In addition, parameters to the $apply operation are available within dynamicValue expressions as context variables, accessible by the name of the parameter, prefixed with a percent (%) symbol. For a more detailed description, refer to the ActivityDefinition resource

parameter.name: activityDefinition
parameter.documentation: The activity definition to apply. If the operation is invoked on an instance, this parameter is not allowed. If the operation is invoked at the type level, this parameter is required

parameter.name: subject
parameter.documentation: The subject(s) that is/are the target of the activity definition to be applied. The subject may be a Patient, Practitioner, Organization, Location, Device, or Group. Subjects provided in this parameter will be resolved as the subject of the PlanDefinition based on the type of the subject. If multiple subjects of the same type are provided, the behavior is implementation-defined

parameter.name: encounter
parameter.documentation: The encounter in context, if any

parameter.name: userType
parameter.documentation: The type of user initiating the request, e.g. patient, healthcare provider, or specific type of healthcare provider (physician, nurse, etc.)

parameter.name: userLanguage
parameter.documentation: Preferred language of the person using the system

parameter.name: userTaskContext
parameter.documentation: The task the system user is performing, e.g. laboratory results review, medication list review, etc. This information can be used to tailor decision support outputs, such as recommended information resources

parameter.name: setting
parameter.documentation: The current setting of the request (inpatient, outpatient, etc.)

parameter.name: settingContext
parameter.documentation: Additional detail about the setting of the request, if any

parameter.name: return
parameter.documentation: The resource that is the result of applying the definition
